channel.title: Client ip, help please?
channel.description:
Hey! I hope this topic belongs to the server related and not the client, even though it's about the client IP. Anyways, let's get started.
I've been inactive for quite a while with all the rsps things, so I don't remember very much anymore.
I recently downloaded "[PI] Orical X v2" (http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,496594.0.html). I can't find out how to change the client ip to 127.0.0.1. Been looking all around the class' and client.java...
Any help is appreciated. Best regards, Extoz.

item.title: Client ip, help please?
item.dc:creator: @Extoz Extoz
item.description:
@Extoz wrote:

[quote=“Adobe, post:4, topic:403961”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=501018.msg3665277#msg3665277 date=1310585174]
client.java in the client search for " server ="
[/quote]
It should have ‘127.0.0.1’ set as default, change that to the IP your hosting on and what not, then in GUI.java you could possibly have to change it aswell, search for something close too: sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName
there will be something after it example: code=java);[/code] change the “example.no-ip.org” to your IP your hosting on or whatever with.

(just alittle more detailed) :rolleyes:[/quote]
I havn’t opened up a host yet, just want to try some coding. I’ll tell you the results in a second.

EDIT: Well, nevermind about that. There’s not even a GUI.java

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:5, topic:403961”]http://lmgtfy.com/?q=how+to+portforward+using+rsps

portforward[/quote]

I know how to portforward… Though I’m wondering if I have to since I’m hosting and playing on the same computer.

Read full topic

@imsuperman05 wrote:

lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

item.title: Client ip, help please?

item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

imsuperman05:

client.java in the client search for " server ="

It should have ‘127.0.0.1’ set as default, change that to the IP your hosting on and what not, then in GUI.java you could possibly have to change it aswell, search for something close too: sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName
there will be something after it example: code=java);[/code] change the “example.no-ip.org” to your IP your hosting on or whatever with.

(just alittle more detailed) :rolleyes:

item.title: Client ip, help please?
item.dc:creator: @Extoz Extoz
item.description:
@Extoz wrote:

Weird, it’s already set to 127.0.0.1… Do I have to open the port? Even through it’s my own internet?

Since I’m having no issues with starting the server sided run up, no errors or likely. The client just wont connect it says.

Read full topic
